level.text: The Commission shall cooperate in the enforcement of United States Amateur Boxing Federation or National Collegiate Athletic Association rules; provided, that these rules are not contrary to this chapter or chapter 16 of this title.
In addition to the requirements of amateur rules, the promoter of an amateur event shall:
Obtain a contest permit prior to holding the event;
Provide the Commission with the tax exemption number of the promoter;
Submit to the Commission, prior to commencement of the event, when admission is charged, a manifest or report on the number, kind, and price of the tickets printed for the event;
Obtain the services of two (2) ringside physicians, licensed and approved by the Commission; and
Ensure the availability of an ambulance on site during the event.
The promoter shall provide, at a minimum, the following:
Rosin boxes;
Gloves;
Water buckets and siphon bottles;
Stretcher;
Adequate lighting;
Stools;
Steps leading into the ring at both corners;
A ring that is ready four (4) hours before the event; and
A ring that is four feet (4’) above the floor, with four (4) strand ropes secured by strings on all sides, corner and canvas paddings one and one-half (1 ½”) inches thick, clean and sanitary.
Each contestant competing in any amateur event shall be properly fitted with, and at all times during the event shall wear, protective head gear and a mouthpiece, approved by the Commission.
Each contestant competing in any amateur event shall use thumbless or thumb- attached padded gloves approved by the Commission.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 35 DCR 3731, 3750-52 (May 20, 1988).
